description: Students experience the dynamic arts and governance environment of Washington, D. C., meeting over
25  professionals in varied fields and visiting galleries, museums, theaters, music and dance
presenters,  arts and civic organizations. The course compares/contrasts expectations for a life
in the arts  with new options. Students embrace interdisciplinarity, collaborate, and discuss,
write, and  reflect on the  arts and democracy. Students participate in a civic engagement
project. Offered periodically  during Interim.  Counts  toward art, art history, and dance majors.
Prerequisites: at least one  fine arts course or arts management course or permission of the
fullname: Arts and Democracy: An ID Fine Arts Interim in Washington, D.C.
